Subject: weight bearing difficulty AE
Value: weight bearing difficulty is a behavior AE that results in difficulty in managing the amount of weight a patient puts on the leg on which surgery has been performed. Subject: medical intervention
Value: medical intervention is a planned process that has the goal of diagnosing, preventing or relieving illness or injury.

Subject: medical intervention
Value: <The act of intervening, interfering or interceding with the intent of modifying the outcome. In medicine, an intervention is usually undertaken to help treat or cure a condition. For example, \"Acupuncture as a therapeutic intervention is widely practiced in the United States,\" Reference:http://www.medterms.com/script/main/art.asp?articlekey=34214 . Some interventions can be used for diagnosis. >

Subject: contusion AE
Value: a haematoma AE that has an outcome of contusion.

Subject: influenza vaccine-induced adverse event
Value: <YH: This term is just used as an example of vaccine induced adverse events. Specific vaccine-associated and vaccine-induced adverse events are now represented with the Ontology of Vaccine Adverse Events (OVAE).: http://www.violinet.org/ovae/. >

Subject: pregnancy AE
Value: A pregnancy, neonatal and perinatal AE that displays a disorder associated with pregnancy.

Subject: clinical laboratory test
Value: a planned process that is specifically a test conducted in a clinical laboratory.

Subject: discomfort AE
Value: a sensory capability AE that resuls in an uncomfortable feeling.

Subject: female reproductive system AE
Value: a reproductive system AE that occurs on the female side.

Subject: male reproductive system AE
Value: a reproductive system AE that occurs on the male side.

Subject: cardiac disorder AE
Value: a cardiovascular disorder AE that has a cardiac disorder outcome.

Subject: dermatitis AE
Value: a skin adverse event that results in an inflammation of skin

Subject: AE incidence rate
Value: A data item that is calculated as the number of patients realized with an adverse event beginning in an interval divided by the number of patients taking the same medical intervention within the same interval. The incidence thus indicates the number of newly occurring events over time.

Subject: cell death AE
Value: a metabolic disorder AE that has an outcome of cell death. @en

Subject: pancreatitis AE
Value: a liver, biliary, and pancreatic AE that has an outcome of pancreatitis.

Subject: cystic fibrosis AE
Value: a syndrome AE that has an outcome of cystic fibrosis, an inherited disease that affects the lungs, digestive system, sweat glands, and male fertility.

Subject: abdominal AE
Value: an adverse event that displays a disorder in abdomen.

Subject: hepatitis AE
Value: a liver, biliary, and pancreatic AE that has an outcome of hepatitis.

Subject: ulcer AE
Value: an adverse event that displays an outcome of ulcer.

Subject: extravasation AE
Value: an abnormal fluid regulation AE which has an outcome of extravasation, a discharge or escape, as of blood, from a vessel into the tissues.

Subject: bradycardia AE
Value: a decreased heart rate AE that results in a resting heart rate of under 60 beats per minutes (BPM). @en

Subject: prenatal, perinatal or neonatal disorder AE
Value: an adverse event that displays a disorder associated with child birth, newborn infant, or an infant.

Subject: administration of drug with omitted dose
Value: an errored drug administration where a patient is administered with an drug without knowing the dose used.

Subject: neonatal AE
Value: A pregnancy, neonatal and perinatal AE that displays a disorder associated with newborn infant or an infant.

Subject: errored medication
Value: a medical intervention that has an errored medication

Subject: application site hypersensitivity AE
Value: a hypersensitivity AE that occurs at the site of an application of a medical intervention (e.g., drug administration or vaccination).

Subject: leukocyte cell number increased AE
Value: increased leukocyte cell number AE

Subject: flu syndrome AE
Value: a syndrome AE that has an outcome of a flu syndrome AE and occurs after a medical intervention.

Subject: central serous retinopathy AE
Value: an abnormal vision AE characterised by leakage of fluid under the retina causing visual impairment, usually in one eye. @en

Subject: central serous retinopathy AE
Value: SJ, YH

Subject: alopecia AE
Value: a hair AE that has an outcome of alopecia and occurs after a medical intervention.

Subject: arthrosis AE
Value: a movement disorder AE that has an outcome of arthrosis.

Subject: angioedema AE
Value: angioneurotic edema

Subject: angioedema AE
Value: <WEB: http://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/hives-and-angioedema/basics/definition/con-20014815>

Subject: acute brain syndrome AE
Value: a syndrome AE that has an outcome of an acute brain syndrome AE and occurs after a medical intervention.

Subject: clonus AE
Value: clonus AE is  a series of involuntary, rhythmic, muscular contractions and relaxations.

Subject: investigation result abnormal AE
Value: an adverse event that is indicated by an abnormal result of an investigation that uses some laboratory equipment, device, or medical technology.

Subject: investigation result abnormal AE
Value: This term is used to replace 'lab test abnormal AE'. The reason for this is that some test, like X-ray test, is not considered by many physicians as a lab test. Therefore, we have used this new term to cover a broader scope. All terms asserted under this term represent the investigation results without defined conclusion of disease.

Subject: death AE
Value: a serious adverse event that has an outcome of death.

Subject: periorbital edema AE
Value: periorbial edema AE is an edema AE that has an outcome of swelling around the eye.

Subject: coagulopathy AE
Value: coagulopathy AE results in the impairment of blood to clot causing ecessive or prolonged bleeding.

Subject: feeling hot AE
Value: Feeling hot AE is a feeling abnormal AE that a patient feels hot.

Subject: ischemic colitis AE
Value: ischemic colitis AE is a gastrointestinal disorder AE that results in injury and inflammation of the large intestine due to inadequate blood supply.

Subject: gastroesophageal reflux disease AE
Value: esophageal reflux AE

Subject: grand mal convulsion AE
Value: tonic seizure

Subject: belief in likelihood of causal connection between medical intervention and adverse event
Value: a belief in likelihood of causal connection between two processes  that represents a belief in likelihood of causal connection between medical intervention m and adverse event e.

Subject: adverse event causality evidence
Value: an information content entity that represents evidence for indicating the causal association between an adverse event and a medical intervention.

Subject: outcome of adverse event causality evidence
Value: an information content entity that represents the outcome of the evidences used for seeking the causal association between an adverse event and a medical intervention.

Subject: Glascow coma scale abnormal AE
Value: a neurological, special senses and psychiatric investigation result abnormal AE that is the abnormal result of the recording of the level of consciousness in a person after a brain injuiry.

Subject: no evidence bearing on an adverse event causal relation
Value: an outcome of adverse event causality evidence  that has an outcome of no evidence bearing on a AE causal relation.

Subject: local swelling AE
Value: a localized edema AE that shows the outcome of swelling.

Subject: occult blood AE
Value: a gastrointestinal investigation result abnormal AE that results in blood  that is present in amounts too small to be seen and can be detected only by chemical analysis or microscopic examination

Subject: adverse event risk difference
Value: a data item that represents the incidence of the adverse event among recipients of a medical intervention (e.g., vaccinatoin) minus the incidence of the adverse event among otherwise similar nonrecipients.

Subject: adverse event risk difference
Value: The AE risk difference depends on both the background incidence of the adverse event (i.e., among nonrecipients) and the relative risk of its occurence in medical intervention recipients versus nonrecipients. Even when the AE rlative risk is high, the AE risk difference will be low if the event is extremely rare.

Subject: prostate examination abnormal AE
Value: SZ, SS, EB

Subject: evidence of biological plausity of adverse event causality
Value: an adverse event causality evidence that has an outcome of biological plausity.

Subject: pulmonary embolism AE
Value: [SS] moved by relation 'SubclassOf' from lung disorder AE to arterial embolism on 01/07/14

Subject: acute kidney injury AE
Value: <As shown on the renal.org website (http://www.renal.org/guidelines/modules/acute-kidney-injury), Acute kidney injury (AKI) has now replaced the term acute renal failure. >

Subject: acute kidney injury AE
Value: <WEB: http://www.mayoclinic.org/diseases-conditions/kidney-failure/basics/definition/con-20024029 >

Subject: adverse event causality evidence from case report
Value: an adverse event causality evidence that comes from a case report.

Subject: adverse event causality evidence from case series
Value: an adverse event causality evidence that comes from the study of a case report series.

Subject: adverse event causality evidence from uncontrolled observational study
Value: an adverse event causality evidence that comes from an uncontrolled observational study

Subject: adverse event causality evidence from controlled observational study
Value: an adverse event causality evidence that comes from controlled observational studies.

Subject: first degree atrioventricular block AE
Value: an atrioventricular block AE that there is some  prolongation of AV conduction time (PR interval). The heart's electrical signals are slowed as they move from the atria to the ventricles (the heart's upper and lower chambers, respectively). This results in a longer, flatter line between the P and the R waves on the EKG (electrocardiogram).

Subject: brain AE
Value: an adverse event that occurs in brain.

Subject: nasal discomfort AE
Value: nasal discomfort AE is a respiratory system AE that shows a discomfort from the nose

Subject: proportional reporting ratio
Value: a data item that represents a statistic to summarize the extent to which a particular adverse event is observed for individuals taking a specific medical intervention (e.g., a drug), compared to the frequency at which the same adverse event occurs for patients taking some other intervention (e.g., other drug or any drug in a specified class of drugs).

Subject: P-value of adverse event causality Chi-square test
Value: an adverse event causality P-value that is calculated out of a specific Chi-square test.

Subject: AE prevalence rate
Value: A data item that is defined as the number of patients realized with an adverse event beginning in an interval or continuing from a previous interval divided by the number of patients taking the same medical intervention within that interval. The prevalence thus indicates the number of events that began and persisted over time.

Subject: nuclear magnetic resonance imaging result abnormal AE
Value: an imaging investigation result abnormal AE that is indicated by an abnormal result of a procedure in which radio waves and a powerful magnet linked to a computer are used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body

Subject: second degree atrioventricular block AE
Value: an atrioventricular block AE that some but not all atrial impulses fail to reach the ventricles, thus some ventricular beats are dropped. Electrical signals between the atria and ventricles are slowed to a large degree. Some signals don't reach the ventricles. On an EKG, the pattern of QRS waves doesn't follow each P wave as it normally would.

Subject: complete atrioventricular block AE
Value:
an atrioventricular block AE that complete atrioventricular dissociation occurs; atria and ventricles beat independently. None of the electrical signals reach the ventricles. This type also is called complete heart block or complete AV block.

When complete heart block occurs, special areas in the ventricles may create electrical signals to cause the ventricles to contract. This natural backup system is slower than the normal heart rate and isn't coordinated with the contraction of the atria. On an EKG, the normal pattern is disrupted. The P waves occur at a faster rate that isn't coordinated with the QRS waves.

Subject: Mobitz type I block AE
Value: a second degree atrioventricular block AE that the electrical signals are delayed more and more with each heartbeat, until the heart skips a beat. On the EKG, the delay is shown as a line (called the PR interval) between the P and QRS waves. The line gets longer and longer until the QRS waves don't follow the next P wave.

Subject: blood folate level abnormal AE
Value: a metabolic and nutritional investigation result abnormal AE that is charaterized by an abnormal blood folate level

Subject: carbon dioxide increased AE
Value: EB

Subject: blood pH increased AE
Value: a blood pH abnormal AE that is characterized by an increased blood pH

Subject: toxicology drug screen result abnormal AE
Value: an investigation result abnormal AE that results from an abnormal toxicology screen

Subject: cytogenetic investigation result abnormal AE
Value: an investigation result abnormal AE that involves an abnormal result of an investigation related to chromosomal abnormalities and pathologic conditions

Subject: is evidence of
Value: <AE1 is_evidence_of AE2 if and only if: given an adverse event instance ae1 that instantiates class AE1 (e.g., electrocardiogram qt prolonged AE) and another adverse event instance ae2 that instantiates class AE2 (e.g., arrhythmia AE), both ae1 and ae2 are adverse events that are clinically observed after a medical intervention (at time t0) on the same patient. The presence of ae1 is supported by priori knowledge of medicine to imply the presence of ae2 with some probability P (P is NOT always 1, thus transitivity does not apply to is_evidence_of relation. AE1 is_evidence_of AE2 and AE2 is_evidence_of AE3 DOES NOT imply AE1 is_evidence_of AE3). The instance ae1 and ae2 are observed or detected at time t1 and t2, respectively. The biological onset time for ae1 or ae2 may occur before t1 or t2. The t1 and t2 can be the same time point or different time points. >

Subject: is evidence of
Value: This represents a relation between two adverse events AE1 and AE2. However, AE1 may be an evidence of another adverse event AE3, and a dfferent adverse event AE4 may also be an evidence of the same AE2.

Subject: retrodictive AE causality
Value: <an adverse event causity that represents a retrodictrive causal relation between an adverse event and a medical intervention. Specifically, it addresses this question: given an individual who has received a medical intervention and developed the adverse event, was the event caused by the medical intervention? >

Subject: mesenteric vein thrombosis AE
Value: <[SS] http://emedicine.medscape.com/article/193921-overview, Mesenteric venous thrombosis (also known as visceral venous thrombosis) is a rare but lethal form of mesenteric ischemia (see the image below). Antonio Hodgson first described mesenteric ischemia in the latter part of the 15th century. In 1895, Elliot first described mesenteric venous thrombosis as a cause of mesenteric ischemia. By the turn of the 19th century, many review articles and texts were describing the recent advances in the characterization and treatment of mesenteric ischemia, particularly venous thrombosis. In 1935, Warren and Eberhard reported that intestinal infarction resulted from ischemia due to venous thrombosis, and they reported a mortality rate of 34% in patients with venous thrombosis after resection. Unfortunately, despite improvements in therapy, this mortality rate still holds.>

Subject: Budd-Chiari syndrome AE
Value: a thrombosis AE that is an uncommon condition induced by thrombotic or nonthrombotic obstruction of hepatic venous outflow and characterized by hepatomegaly, ascites, and abdominal pain.

Subject: predictive AE causality
Value: <an adverse event causity that represents a predictive causal relation between an adverse event and a medical intervention. Specifically, it addresses this question: will the next person who received a medical intervention will develop the adverse event? Or: how frequently will vaccine recipients experience the adverse event as a result of a medical intervention? >

Subject: pelvic venous thrombosis AE
Value: a deep vein thrombosis AE that occurs in the pelvis. Ovarian vein thrombosis arises out of the coincident conditions of venous stasis and hypercoagulability, which are commonly present in the recently postpartum patient.

Subject: subclavian vein thrombosis AE
Value: a thrombosis AE that occurs in subclavian vein. Among patients with effort-induced thrombosis with subclavian vein stenosis, the thrombosis occurs in the dominant arm in 80% of cases.

Subject: retinal vein occlusion AE
Value: a thrombosis that is characterized by a blockage of the small veins that carry blood away from the retina. The retina is the layer of tissue at the back of the inner eye that converts light images to nerve signals and sends them to the brain.

Subject: Clostridium difficile infection AE
Value: a clostridial infection AE that is caused by C. difficule.

Subject: drug toxicity
Value: a quality that represents the level of critical or lethal reaction to an erroneous dosage of a drug medication.

Subject: pancreatic abscess AE
Value: <WEB: http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/000270.htm >

Subject: pancreas transplant rejection AE
Value: <WEB: http://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/436542_13 >

Subject: pyogenic infection AE
Value: <WEB: http://www.medilexicon.com/medicaldictionary.php?t=44396 >

Subject: time interval for initial process after medical intervention
Value: a temporal interval that starts at the time a medical intervention occurs and ends at the time when the initial bodily process occurs.

Subject: time interval for intermediate causal AE process
Value: a temporal interval that starts at the time in the end of the initial process and ends at the time when the final process leading to an adverse event clinical outcome occurs.

Subject: time interval for AE process showing clinical outcome
Value: a temporal interval that covers the time period of the final process leading to the display of clinical outcome.

Subject: intermediate stage causal AE sub-process
Value: a pathological bodily process that occurs in the middle of the causal adverse event process, i.e., after the initial causal AE process and before the last AE process that results in the adverse outcome.

Subject: late stage AE formation sub-process
Value: a pathological bodily process that occurs in the last stage of adverse event and results in the adverse clinical outcome. This clinical outcome may come as a result of causal adverse event (caused by the medical intervention), or result from an unrelevant cause (i.e., not the designated medical intervention).

Subject: adverse event time period
Value: a temporal interval that starts at the time a medical intervention occurs and ends at the time an adverse event ends. The adverse event ends when the patient recovers from the adverse event or dies due to the severity of the adverse event.

Subject: time interval for causal AE
Value: an adverse event tme period whent the adverse event is causal adverse event.

Subject: X-ray clinical test
Value: a clincal laboratory test that performs a medical examination using X-ray, a type of electromagnetic radiation.

Subject: numbness AE
Value: a sensory capability AE that has an outcome of numbness, a loss of sensation of feeling in a part of the body.

Subject: circumoral numbness AE
Value: The terms 'circumoral numbness AE' and 'circumoral paresthesia AE' appear to be synonyms.

Subject: systemic lupus erythematosus AE
Value: Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) syndrome AE is a lupus syndrome AE that is systemic and disseminated. SLE most often harms the heart, joints, skin, lungs, blood vessels, liver, kidneys, and nervous system. Although “lupus” actually includes a number of different diseases, SLE is the most common type of lupus, and when people say “lupus,” they are often referring to SLE.
